strategy: Introduce a physics-based action prediction layer that models the expected next state (position and velocity) based on current state and action, using a lightweight neural ordinary differential equation (Neural ODE) to simulate the underlying dynamics of the MountainCar system. This layer predicts the next state trajectory and is used as a regularization term during training—only actions that result in plausible, physically consistent trajectories (e.g., no impossible velocity spikes or position jumps) are rewarded. This forces the agent to learn dynamics-aware policies, reducing trial-and-error in low-reward regions by grounding actions in physical plausibility.
